intro: Monogynella formosana, commonly known as the Formosan monogynella, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
